Docs.summary: Defines methods for obtaining and releasing an existing handle to a Windows device context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A device context defines the graphics object for drawing on a Windows-based device. An example of a class that implements the <xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext> interface is the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class.

Docs.summary: Returns the handle to a Windows device context.
Docs.returns: An representing the handle of a device context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext.GetHdc%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext.ReleaseHdc%2A> are two methods that allow you to get and release the handle for a Windows-based device. You should always follow a call to <xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext.GetHdc%2A> with a call to <xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext.ReleaseHdc%2A> when you are finished with the Windows handle.
<xref:System.Drawing.IDeviceContext.GetHdc%2A> is not designed to obtain handles created using Windows GDI methods such as `CreateDC` or `CreateCompatibleDC`.
